data.title: Go to Breakfast
data.text: Small place, breakfast is great.  Service can be spotty at times, although, it almost appears (recently) that they have new management because we have been noticing a lot more servers which means the service has been faster.  Faster doesn't necessarily mean better.  But lets face it, I come here for the food. Weekends can get pretty busy.

data.title: This is a good place for the seniors to have breakfast and visit with friends.
data.text: The atmosphere here is slow and easy. The service can be also, but many seniors like to come for breakfast here. The portions are large and the good is ok.

data.title: Breakfast at Lunch
data.text:
Stopped by this restaurant while out doing errands. This establishment tucked quietly into a corner strip mall, sufficient parking and ease of access.
The wait staff was pleasant and helpful, Their menu boasted of breakfast combinations with their unique twist.
Their food was bland, but good. Allowing you to add your own variety of seasonings.
I am spoiled to my spouses buttermilk pancakes, but their pancakes had an unfamiliar taste.  Worth a try to adventurous patrons.

data.title: A great place to eat
data.text:
I've been going to this location which has changed names often for over 20 years. The new owner has this down! It's open for breakfast and lunch; and when you walk in and see the very retro look, you may be inclined to leave; trust me - don't!

The food is tremendous, the portions are generous. The staff is engaging and very attentive. My favorites are the patty melt and Chicken tortilla soup. Nothing fancy, but it gets to the point where I crave it and will take the time to make a 30 mile round trip from work to have it.

Try it, I think you'll find that you get more than you pay for, and will feel better after having eaten there.

data.title: Below average
data.text: My wife and I went there for breakfast she ordered a bacon croissant with hash browns and pancakes I ordered a sausage sandwich with no marinara or peppers and crispy fries ! what we got was A mozzarella cheese egg on white toast with dried out hash browns, and I got a sausage with marinara no cheese the waitress was asked to fix it and they brought back the sandwich correctly but they took the fries from my first order and put them back on the second plate, so they weren't hot! I wouldn't have minded if they weren't trying to be so sneaky !the place is an older building not real clean !service was mediocre at best I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone !take your chances?

data.title: Great place with reasonable prices
data.text: First time visit to JR's. They have a nice varied menu with not only the normal breakfast fare, but also salads and sandwiches.  The pancakes are quite nice with a fluff and cakelike texture not rubbery. I plan to try the Frittata next time. Apparently the owner is Greek and this is a specialty. The waitress was very kind and helpful. She did a great job keeping drinks refilled and the food came out quickly. Their hours are 6am until 3pm and closed on Mondays. We went on Sunday around 11 am.  The parking lot may appear full but there is a church I think or something as the inside had plenty of tables when we were concerned it might be packed. SO don't let that steer you away.  The omelet came with two pancakes and also grits. The grits were creamy not loose and runny like you find in some places. Plenty of food at a good price.

data.title: Very good food
data.text: The food is really good and the employees really friendly, great breakfast, large portions and very reasonable.
